A hasty developer encrypts a secret with RSA, mistakenly using a modulus that's the product of two Blum integers. Can you recover the flag from 2704247376614082540839950211153892080056641048602244139430702706959412148492959458249996592541802793401575798051469460444811904502448246000309080286714747?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=7465011229056910123883052242730631748460479772033126634318733045061250082346185007014810856278352501649532498134831172855984407967837933843015298721112173, e=4021025578595950089463282133302728395934028236689324985475083573690728661267433648771975923376288404964647814955301839416786783165012604162835293577789257
The lower 104 bits of p are: 2582812539693302861732086674355152271


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{6lehmaab}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2704247376614082540839950211153892080056641048602244139430702706959412148492959458249996592541802793401575798051469460444811904502448246000309080286714747
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7465011229056910123883052242730631748460479772033126634318733045061250082346185007014810856278352501649532498134831172855984407967837933843015298721112173, e=4021025578595950089463282133302728395934028236689324985475083573690728661267433648771975923376288404964647814955301839416786783165012604162835293577789257
The lower 104 bits of p are: 2582812539693302861732086674355152271

extra_info: p=88115728963233490120575556088048673819889560087606478141103269667643419813263, q=84718259916702327504753847450881463727408445887734272288895266636265669653571, Ï†(n)=7465011229056910123883052242730631748460479772033126634318733045061250082346012173025930920460727172245993567997283874850009067217407935306711389631645340
